posts.name: Lara Cesco-Cancian
posts.cooked: We’re looking for recommendations for a staple gun to use in bumper building. We’ve had multiple in the past and have never been happy with them. Does anyone have a staple gun they love?

posts.name: Patrick
posts.cooked: The Bea might be a little harder to find, but get a pneumatic stapler for 3/8 crown fine wire staples. If you get lucky and fine a cheap used one, you can get fully automatic staplers the put out several staples a second when you hold the trigger down. (Be careful with those or they will cut the fabric with the staples)

posts.name: Timothy Angert
posts.cooked: If you if you already have the Milwaukee M12 platform then Milwaukee makes a cordless stapler that’s really nice.   If you don’t then I would recommend just getting a corded stapler We have one from arrow that works great

posts.name: Patrick
posts.cooked:
For bumpers, you can get away with almost anything, but there is a reason every furniture company I’ve worked with used BeA pneumatic staplers. They are lightyears better than any electric I have every used. They can put out staples faster than you can move your trigger finger, they have no kickback, you can slightly vary your hand pressure to leave the staples proud or sink them .030 below the surface of the plywood, they work perfectly with a single hand and very little hand pressure so you have a free hand to pull fabric, and can get them in awkward positions.

If you want a stapler that works well enough for bumpers and don’t have shop air, buy electric. If you want a stapler you will actually love buy an industrial pneumatic fine wire stapler.

posts.name: Paul Eggerding
posts.cooked:
The Pneumatic Upholstery Staple Gun is the best staple gun for upholstery, furniture, vinyl and marine applications. Powered by air for consistent performance.

PRICE:  undefined

These are affordable and fantastic. My family has an upholstery business and has put many thousands of staples in with these guys.

link_counts.title: Pneumatic Upholstery Staple Gun - Short Nose

posts.cooked:
So happy to see this suggestion.

The BeA 71/16-421 or 401 is basically the gold standard for upholstery staple guns. I own an upholstery business and we have a dozen of them. My gun is 20+ years old. You cab usually pick up a used one on ebay for around $100ish.

For just doing bumpers you can get away with most anything, but a quality staple gun will last a lifetime.

posts.name: Aidan Mundy
posts.cooked:
We have this one from McMaster. Works great, no complaints.

McMaster-Carr is the complete source for your plant with over 595,000 products. 98% of products ordered ship from stock and deliver same or next day.
